p: On the other hand, Mucoromycota were absent in this contaminated soil. Unlike Morais et al. (2016) who found more than 50% of Mucoromycota in a petroleum contaminated costal site, we did not identified any organism belonging to this phylum. Mucoromycota represented a small fraction of the isolates also in an estuarine sediment contaminated mainly by PAHs ( Da Silva et al., 2003) and in heavy crude oil-contaminated soil ( Zafra et al., 2014). In the present study, Mucoromycota could be included in the “unclassified” group (Figure 3), even though they would be a negligible fraction of the mycoflora.
